title.narrative: 1.1 HAC 1 CAPACITY BUILDING OF Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) INSTITUTIONS

description.narrative: 1.1 Sector authorities and stakeholders have the evidence and capacities to implement affordable, sustainable, climate-smart and disaster responsive Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services for all., which contributes to Evaluation, Hygiene, Research, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water Supply, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 1. By the end of 2022, most disadvantaged children have access to enhanced health and nutrition practices2. Sustained use of safe water supply and sanitation services, and adoption of hygiene practices, by children and their families in poor communities vulnerable to climate change, conflict and public health emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1 Sector authorities and stakeholders have the evidence and capacities to implement affordable, sustainable, climate-smart anddisaster responsive WASH services for all.

description.narrative: In the year 2021, the UNICEF WASH team played a crucial role in supporting the Lebanese Government by influencing their agendas on climate resilience, environmental degradation, and relationship building between water establishments and the public. These interventions&39; objectives revolved around the reduction of tense social environments and overall tension within various communities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/12/2021
